validationRules.btnLink.url: Required for CTA buttons - Link URL

validationRules.btnIcon: Boolean - Set true to show icon

warnings: Download buttons require actual file at downloadFile.url (test downloads in production)
Progress indicator (style-5) requires JavaScript - ensure scripts are loaded
Emoji reactions (style-8) require Unicode emoji support (test on target browsers)
Extra text overlays vary by style - not all styles support all extraText fields
target='_blank' for external links should include security attributes (auto-added by WordPress)
Download progress only works with style-5 - other styles show instant download
dst3MWidth only applies to download style-3 (ignored for other styles)
Large downloadFile sizes (>10MB) may cause browser timeout - test thoroughly
Custom iconImage requires image file - FontAwesome is more reliable
commonMistakes: Setting btnType='download' but forgetting to set downloadFile.url
Using dst5LoadingText/dst5SuccessText with styles other than style-5
Setting nmlEmoji/hvrEmoji with styles other than style-8 (no effect)
Forgetting ariaLabel for accessibility (especially important for icon-only buttons)
Not testing actual file downloads (broken download links)
Using very long extraText that breaks layout on mobile
Setting btnIcon=true but not providing iconName or iconImage
Using incompatible extraText fields for current style (e.g., extraText2 on style that doesn't support it)
Not setting responsive btnWidth (creates oversized buttons on mobile)
Forgetting to set btnBgType.openBg: 1 before setting background color
bestPractices: Always set ariaLabel for accessibility (describe button action clearly)
For download buttons, include file info in extraText (e.g., 'PDF Â· 2.3 MB')
Test emoji rendering on target browsers/devices (some emojis vary by platform)
Use style-5 for large file downloads to show progress feedback
Set responsive btnWidth to avoid oversized buttons on mobile
Use external link icon (fa-external-link-alt) for target='_blank' links
For promotions, use style-6 with extraText1/extraText2 for urgency/scarcity
Include hover states (btnHvrColor, btnHvrBgType) for visual feedback
Use gradient backgrounds sparingly - solid colors convert better
For file downloads, use green colors (#10b981) - convention for downloads
Test actual downloads in production environment before launch
accessibilityNotes: Always provide ariaLabel for screen readers (especially icon-only buttons)
ariaLabel should describe action and outcome (e.g., 'Download PDF guide - 2.3 MB')
Ensure sufficient color contrast: WCAG AA requires 4.5:1 for text
Button text should be descriptive (avoid 'Click Here' - use 'Download Guide')
External links should indicate 'opens in new tab' in ariaLabel
Emoji-only buttons need descriptive ariaLabel (emojis aren't read by screen readers)
Download progress should have aria-live region for state announcements
Focus state should be visible for keyboard navigation
Disabled state should be communicated via aria-disabled attribute
performanceConsiderations: Download progress (style-5) uses JavaScript - minimal performance impact
Large downloadFile sizes may cause browser memory issues
Emoji rendering varies by platform - no performance impact
Gradient backgrounds use GPU compositing - hardware accelerated
Icon images require HTTP requests - FontAwesome is cached
Hover effects use CSS transitions - no JavaScript cost
Multiple extra text layers add minimal DOM nodes
Progress bar animations target 60fps for smooth experience

notes: Test emoji rendering on Windows, Mac, iOS, Android
Some emojis look different across platforms
Keep emojis relevant to action (don't use random emojis)
Consider cultural differences in emoji meanings

problemsAndSolutions.solution: Check downloadFile.url points to actual file. Verify file permissions on server. Test URL in browser directly.
Ensure JavaScript is enabled. Check browser console for errors. Verify file size is large enough to show progress.
Verify Unicode emoji is used (not image emoji). Test on target browser/device. Use common emojis for better support.
Verify style supports extra text (e.g., style-6 for extraText1/2, style-8 for emojis). Check spelling of attribute names.
Set btnIcon: true. Verify iconName has valid FontAwesome class. Ensure Font Awesome is loaded on site.
Set responsive btnWidth: {xs: '100%'} or reduce padding for mobile breakpoint.
Set btnBgType.openBg: 1. Verify bgType is 'color' or 'gradient'. Check bgDefaultColor is set.
